         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 606 of the tax law  is  amended  by  adding  a  new

    3    (SS) FOSTER CHILD ADOPTION CREDIT. (1) ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. A RESIDENT

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1636

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the tax law, in relation to the establishment of a tax credit
for the adoption of a foster child

PURPOSE:
To establish a $2,000 tax credit to help pay for the expenses
associated with the adoption of a child.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 606 of the tax law is amended by adding a new section qq, qq
(1) allows a tax credit for the adoption of a foster child by their
foster parents.

Section 2 defines the tem1 "foster child adoption".

Section 3 defines the amount of credit as $2,000.

JUSTIFICATION:
Foster parents who open their homes and hearts to care for abused or
neglected children should receive the help they require to provide
stable environments for these young people. The process of
permanently adopting a foster child is lengthy and expensive. The
expenses involved with the adoption often drain a foster parent's
resources to the point that home ownership becomes an unattainable
dream. New York foster parents should not have to choose between home
ownership and the children they have come to love and think of as
their own. This legislation will help foster parents to become
homeowners.

EXISTING LAW:
There is currently no tax credit for adoptive parents who wish to
become homeowners.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
S.5916A of 2007
05/23/07 Referred to Investigations & Governmental Operations
S.114 of 2009
01/07/09 Referred to Investigations & Government Operations
01/06/10 Referred to Investigations & Government Operations

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
Unknown.

LOCAL FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
Unknown.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to taxable
years commencing on or after January 1, 2013.
